response.answer:
Thank you for your ticket regarding the missing booking confirmation email from VETTrak. Based on the information provided, it seems like an issue where VETTrak is not sending the booking confirmation email to you even though the booking is being received and processed successfully.

Unfortunately, I could not find any specific solution or configuration setting in the available references to resolve this issue. [1] This appears to be a limitation or potential bug in the VETTrak system for not sending out the booking confirmation email notifications.

To address this, I recommend logging a feature request or bug report with the ReadyTech development team so they can investigate and potentially implement a fix or enhancement to ensure that booking confirmation emails are sent out as expected. [1] I will reach out to the relevant team to log this request for further investigation and resolution. Please let me know if you have any other details or requirements regarding this issue.

affecting many customers

You can see these applications by using their direct URLs instead of searching for them in the UI. The easiest way of accessing these URLs

that I know is as follows (please note this will only work for level 0 users):

1. Navigate to Letters & Forms > Advanced for the party with the missing applications.

2. Add the following code to the source code section of the page (replace jobreadyplus.com with vettrakcloud.com.au for vtcloud clients).

1#{party.course_applications.each do |app|} https://{system[site_name]}.jobreadyplus.com/course_applications/{a260

3. Now click preview and it should give you a list of URLs for each of the parties course applications.

4. Try these URL’s and you should be able to find the disabled course application.

This method is relying on the fact that each course applications ID matches the number at the end of the URL for viewing that course

application. It is then getting a list of the IDs of each course application linked to the party and formatting them as links.

If for some reason you cannot use the above method I would recommend using the audit trail to find the course application numbers.

2#{end}

FAQ’s

Why doesn’t the SMS support two-way email communication?

Such functionality would require ReadyTech to have direct and complete access to your organisation's email server. This would in turn create a greater attack

surface for ReadyTech and our customers, adding a security risk that runs counter to what we would consider acceptable. Were we to offer an integration that

ran both ways, if an attacker were to compromise your Student Management System, then they would have complete control of email communication, which

could lead to other integration systems becoming compromised. From this position, an attacker could perform phishing attacks on your personnel and clients

leading to yet more damage.1. Create two CNAME records: one with the name

mte1._domainkey.yourdomain.com* with the value dkim1.mandrillapp.com, and another with the name mte2._domainkey.yourdomain.com* and

the value dkim2.mandrillapp.com

Digital Certificates – Starter Pack

Digital credentials in vocational education and training (VET) offer more flexible ways of providing learning recognition. They also streamline emerging and urgent skills needs – join us as we introduce how they work within your system. Helpful Resources   QVault Overview

JR Plus - Purchase additional digital certificates (pay with Credit Card)  VETtrak Cloud - Purchase additional digital certificates (pay with Credit Card)  Purchase additional digital certificates (Request invoice)

FAQ  Q. What does it cost to implement and make use of digital certificates? A. There is no implementation cost involved with digital certificates. You simply need to purchase your required quantity of certificates (minimum 100) and top up as required. Each certificate costs $2 AUD (excl. GST). There are no additional fees. Q. Do the pre-purchased certificates expire? A. Yes, there is a 12-month expiry on purchased certificates. We recommend purchasing the required amount of certificates and then topping up as required, rather than purchasing excess certificates. Q. What does the implementation process involve? A. Once you have purchased your required quantity of digital certificates, our team will be in touch to ensure your integration is set up. As the in the integration work has already been done, there is no additional implementation and onboarding required. Once the team has enabled the feature in your student management system, it’s ready to be put to use! Q. Are the digital certificates generated from the student management system or learning management system? A. The digital certificates offering is integrated with the student management system, meaning that all certificates will need to be generated against parties inside the SMS. Q. Can you re-issue certificates that have previously been issued (either physically or digitally)? A. Yes, you can re-issue digital certificates directly from your student management system. Q.

ticket_content.ticket_title: Editing the Course Application Resume email #62144
ticket_content.ticket_description: How do I edit the Course Application Resume email that is received by students when they save a course form? These don t appear under the student communication log nor do they sit under the kanban/workflow automations.

response.answer:
To edit the email sent to students when they save an incomplete course form/application to resume later:

1. Go to "Administration > Lookups > Course Applications Setup" and locate the status that is applied when a student saves a course form to complete later (e.g. "Save/Resume" status). [7]

2. Under that status, check if an email template is currently associated with it in the "Default Email Template" field. If so, go to "Administration > Templates > Entities > Course Application > Templates" and locate/edit that template. [1, 2, 3, 8]

3. If no email template is associated with the "Save/Resume" status, create a new one by going to "Administration > Templates > Entities > Course Application > Templates" and clicking the "+" button. [1, 2, 3, 8] Customize the template content, layout, and settings as desired.

4. Once the template is created/edited, go back to the "Save/Resume" status under "Administration > Lookups > Course Applications Setup" and associate the template in the "Default Email Template" field. [7]

If the above steps do not allow editing the email for saving an incomplete course form, it may be a new feature that is not yet fully configured. In that case, I will reach out to the development team to investigate further enhancements needed for this functionality. [Citation: Not found in references]

related_knowledge.content:
Process: Add an Email Template for a Course Application Status

When using the Course Application Status feature, it is possible to associate an Email Template so that when the Status is applied to a Students Course Application, the system will then automate the sending, of this Email Template, to the Student. Please Note  When using this guide to Create an Email Template, you create an Email Template that can only be accessed and applied to a Course Application Status. This Email Template will not be available for general use in other areas of the system.

We have linked the Category title Kanban. This makes it easy to differentiate between the Email Templates later on. Document Category - As this is an Email Template for an Application Status, we recommend selecting Applications. Allow Custom Code - If you prefer to edit the contents of the Email Template using HTML, select this option to change the Content Editor. Portal - If checked, when this Email Template has been Produced, it will become available as a Document in the Student/Employer Portals. Complete the Content window. This is where you can design the contents and format of the email. On the right-hand side, the dynamic fields make it possible for the system to merge in the information that is specific to that Student. For generic content that must be included no matter who the Student is, type it into the content window. Click, Create. You have now created an Email Template for a Course Application Status.

How to Create an Email Template  To Create an Email Template, follow these instructions:   Click on the Administration tab. Select Templates and then Entities. From the Entity list view, find and click on Course Application. From the left-hand menu, select the Templates option under Letters and Forms. To add a new Email Template, click on the '+' button. Complete the Details window. Name - Give the Email template a unique yet relevant name. This will make it easier to search for later on. From - It is possible to attach multiple Email Accounts to the system. This dropdown list will show all available/connected email accounts so that you can select who this email should come from. Subject - This will be the subject of the email to the Student  Status - This box is used to Enable/Disable an Email Template. If you want the Email Template to be accessible for use, check this box. However, if you no longer need this template, you can uncheck the template so that it can no longer be applied. Format - As this is an email, you will need to select HTML. Type - This is a customizable dropdown list where you can select an option to define the Type of Email Template further. The options in this dropdown list can be customised via the Reference Data Tables. Layout - As this is an email, you will need to select Email: A4 Portrait. Category - You can Add/Edit the available list of Categories by selecting Letters and Forms by going to the Categories page from the left-hand menu.

Edit a Course Form  To edit a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. + New - Create a new Course Form. Search- Search for an existing Course Form. Edit Web Form - Edit the physical web form itself. Edit Form Settings - Edit the settings of the Course Form. Copy - Create a duplicate of an existing Course Form. Delete - Delete an existing Course Form. Click, the EditIcon. To edit the Web Form click this Icon. To edit the Form Settings click this Icon. Make any required changes. Click, Save. You have now edited an existing Course Form.

You can add additional email recipients. Click on the Plus button in the header to add a field to input an email address, you can also set the additional recipient as a CC

or BCC. Once you have completed your email to the student, click on the Send button.

Emailing Multiple Students in a Course  You can email multiple students at once from a course. Go to the course and click on Email → Compose. Layout:

The layout for the email, it is recommended that you leave this as is. Document Category:

If you choose to attach a file to the email, it will be added to the course documents under this category. New File:

You can upload a file from your computer that will be sent to the students as an email attachment. Or URL:

You can specify a link to a file that will be attached to the emails. Template:

The template for the email content. The layout will be switched to the same one as the template’s default layout. Subject: The subject line for the email, this will get prefilled when you select a template that contains a subject line.

Message Content: This will be the content that the student receives in the email. You can write something in here manually or use a template to automatically fill it in. There are also some formatting tools under the content box. Scroll down to see a list of the active students in the course. Check the box next to each student that you would like to email, you can also search for specific students using the search bar.

Note  If a student doesn't have an email address on their party profile, they will not be selectable on this screen.

Once you have completed your email to the selected students, click on the Send

button.

Emailing Multiple Students Using the Enrolment List  If you need to email multiple students that are in different courses, you can email them using Bulk Actions on the Enrolment List. The

Sending Emails to Students

Email is an essential tool for communicating with your students and there are a few different ways to do this within your Student Management System. In this article, we will cover some different methods of emailing students.

Warning  You will need to have the emailing functionality already set up within your Student Management System. This can be done by setting up an SMTP provider or configuring Mandrill. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Emailing An Individual Student  Emailing Multiple Students in a Course  Emailing Multiple Students Using the Enrolment List     Emailing An Individual Student  Emailing an individual student is as simple as finding the party profile for that student. Once you are at the student’s party profile, go to Email → Compose. To: This will be prefilled with the email address from the student’s party profile by default. You can enter a different email address by typing it into this field and pressing the ENTER key. From:

If you have any

From

addresses setup in your site, you can select them in this field. The

From address will be displayed as the Sender

address in the email.

Template:

You can select a template to prefill the email message content. The layout will be automatically switched to the same one as the template’s default layout. Layout:

The layout for the email, it is recommended that you leave this as is. Subject:

The subject line for the email, this will get prefilled when you select a template that contains a subject line. Message Content:

This will be the content that the student receives in the email. You can write something in here manually or use a template to automatically fill it in. There are also some formatting tools under the content box.

Attachment:

You can attach a file to the email that will be sent to the student as an attachment. Additional Email Recipients:

Add a Course Application Status  To Add a Course Application Status, follow these instructions:   Click on the Administration tab. Select Lookups and then Course Applications Setup. To add a new Course Application Status, click on the '+' button. Complete the Course Application Status > New fields. Status Window     Name - Give the Status a unique name. This is what will be displayed on the Student's Course Application. Colour - Choose a colour from the available list of colours. Kanban Status - Choose the Kanban Status of which to associate the Course Application Status. When you drag the application into a new column, it will only show the associate Course Application Status that have been attached. If the Kanban Status dropdowns are not correct, you may not have yet set up your Kanban Status columns. Default Email Template - When a Status is applied to a Course Application, you can choose to have the system create and send a pre-created Email Template. This dropdown will include a list of pre-created Email Templates. You may need to create the Email Templates before your selection is available. Require Reason - This field is typically used in the final Kanban column. In this case, the Application Close column. For example, A student may choose to Withdraw their Course Application. The Course Application Status may be Withdrawn, but that does not provide the institution with much information around why they chose to withdraw their Course Application.

Category - You can Add/Edit the available list of Categories by selecting Letters and Forms by going to the Categories page from the left-hand menu. We recommend using the linked the Category title Kanban. This makes it easy to differentiate between the Email Templates later on. Document Category - Select a relevant Document Category to identify this template. Allow Custom Code - If you prefer to edit the contents of the Email Template using HTML, select this option to change the Content Editor. Portal - If checked, when this Email Template has been Produced, it will become available as a Document in the Student/Employer Portals. Complete the Content window. This is where you can design the contents and format of the email. On the right-hand side, the dynamic fields make it possible for the system to merge in the information that is specific to that Student. For generic content that must be included no matter who the Student is, type it into the content window. Click, Create. You have now created an Email Template.

Resource Links

FAQ What are Course Forms? Course Forms enable each organisation to design its own application or enrolment form and publish online via our portals and their own website. All four ReadySMS Workflows utilise Course Forms. The online forms are created using our easy-to-use user interface and can fully replace paper-based systems. The key features include:    The capture of regulatory data    Mandatory/non mandatory fields    Customisable questions, including:    Multiple choice    Tags/Properties    Dropdown    Short and paragraph questions    Rating questions      File uploads functionality    Partial form saving for later completion Search and selection of single or multiple programs    Secure payments through the integration of a payment gateway    Course Forms also allow enrolments to be either auto-confirmed or sent through to the application centre for additional vetting. When used in conjunction with the student portal, applicants will be able to view all their current applications and the corresponding status. All information captured through Course Forms is automatically uploaded into your student management system. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

response.answer:
Thank you for reporting this email issue. It appears the "reply to user" setting is not enabled for the "info@auctusgroup.com.au" sender email address in your system email configuration. [4, 6]

To resolve this, please follow these steps:

1. Go to Administration > Configuration > Preferences > Communications tab.
2. Under "Email Address Settings", find the "info@auctusgroup.com.au" sender address and click "Edit".
3. Check the box for "Reply to user" to enable replies to go to that email address.
4. Click "Save" to update the email sender configuration.

This should ensure that when emails are sent from "info@auctusgroup.com.au", any replies will be directed to that shared inbox rather than the individual sender's email address.

Please let me know if this resolves the issue or if you need any further assistance.

FAQ’s

Why doesn’t the SMS support two-way email communication?

Such functionality would require ReadyTech to have direct and complete access to your organisation's email server. This would in turn create a greater attack

surface for ReadyTech and our customers, adding a security risk that runs counter to what we would consider acceptable. Were we to offer an integration that

ran both ways, if an attacker were to compromise your Student Management System, then they would have complete control of email communication, which

could lead to other integration systems becoming compromised. From this position, an attacker could perform phishing attacks on your personnel and clients

leading to yet more damage.1. Create two CNAME records: one with the name

mte1._domainkey.yourdomain.com* with the value dkim1.mandrillapp.com, and another with the name mte2._domainkey.yourdomain.com* and

the value dkim2.mandrillapp.com

Logging In/Accessing The System

Your organisation's student management system can be accessed via a unique web URL - formatted like so:   https://<Unique Name Here>.vettrakcloud.com.au  https://<Unique Name Here>.jobreadyplus.com   This is accessed via a web browser to display your

login screen for the system:     Please Note  The above is an example - your login screen may appear quite different depending on your product and branding preferences! Immediately you are offered the opportunity to enter the following details:   Username - The username associated with your

User Profile.

Password - This may be a

temporary password created for your account. If your company is brand new to the system – you may have had these initial details communicated to you via email! If your Organisation was already using the system

– you may need to confirm these details with your organisation's system administrator. They would be equipped to provide the URL,

Username and

Password for you to get started. Once you have successfully accessed the system, you should be viewing your Dashboard.

Process: Configuring Your Email Settings

Having the ability to email your students is a crucial feature in a Student Management System. In this article, we will go over the process of configuring your email settings. SMTP Information  You will need an SMTP email provider in order to send emails out of your system. Some commonly used options are:   Gmail - Gmail SMTP can be used as an email provider, you will need to follow the instructions in this article on their help centre: Send email with the Gmail SMTP server  Microsoft Outlook - Outlook can be used as an email provider as well, you will need to follow the instructions in this article on their help centre: Enable or disable authenticated client SMTP submission (SMTP AUTH) in Exchange Online Note that SMTP authentication for sending emails is disabled by default and will need to be re-enabled. Alert - Deprecation of Basic Authentication  Microsoft has warned that Exchange Online customers will no longer be able to turn on Basic Authentication starting January 2023. Basic Authentication is a legacy authentication method that involves sending user credentials in plain text to computer systems. It doesn’t support multi-factor authentication (MFA), making it easier for threat actors to steal credentials via sophisticated cyber attacks. Mandrill can be set up as the email provider for your site and doesn't require much set up or maintenance. This will need to be set up by ReadyTech upon request.

ticket_content.ticket_title: Delivery Mode: Course Set up: Settings: Future Skills - Sandbox #66747
ticket_content.ticket_description: Dear Team,  As discussed with our course coordinators, the mode of delivery is blended  Blended  from ASQA definition. Based on JR options please let us know which is the best mode of delivery for blended mode from below available option.   Delivery Mode   Combination of all Modes   Combination of external and workplace  based   Combination of internal and external   Combination of internal and workplace based   ExternalOnly   Internal Only   Not Applicable  RPLor Credit Transfer   Workplace  based only

response.answer:
For a course with a blended delivery mode that combines internal (face-to-face) and external (online/distance) components, the appropriate value to select in JobReady for the "Delivery Mode" and "Predominant Delivery Mode" fields would be "Combination of internal and external". [1, 2, 3, 6]

This value accurately reflects the blended nature of the course delivery, which aligns with the ASQA definition provided of a blended mode that includes both internal and external components.

related_knowledge.content:
of the values in the Delivery mode identifier  data element and is the largest or only component.

Predominant delivery mode  ‘E — External delivery’ indicates that external delivery is specified as

one of the values in the Delivery mode identifier  data element and is the largest or only component.

Predominant delivery mode  ‘W — Workplace-based delivery’ indicates that workplace-based

delivery is specified as one of the values in the Delivery mode identifier  data element and is the

largest or only component.

Predominant delivery mode ‘N — Not applicable’ indicates recognition of prior learning or credit

transfer and reported as ‘NNN’ in the Delivery mode identifier  data element.

GUIDELINES FOR USE

Predominant delivery mode  is based on delivery mode details reported in Delivery mode identifier .

Where the training organisation indicates in Delivery mode identifier  that there is more than one

delivery mode, the mode which has the largest component of delivery should be applied as the

predominant delivery mode.

Where the training organisation indicates in Delivery mode identifier  that the training activity has

only one delivery mode, that mode should be applied as the Predominant delivery mode .

Where the training organisation indicates in Delivery mode identifier  that there is no delivery mode,

as is the case with recognition of prior learning or credit transfer, the value ‘N — Not applicable’

should be applied as the predominant delivery mode.

RELATED DATA

Delivery mode identifier

TYPE OF RELATIONSHIP

Delivery mode identifier identifies whether or not a subject comprises internal, external or

workplace-based delivery — or a combination of these modes.

CLASSIFICATION SCHEME

VALUE DESCRIPTION – PREDOMINANT DELIVERY MODE

E External delivery

I Internal delivery

W Workplace-based delivery

N Not applicable – recognition of prior learning/credit transfer

QUESTION

workplace-based delivery – or a combination of these modes.

CONTEXT

Delivery mode identifier  is used to analyse training activity by training delivery modes. It can also

be used to identify training that is delivered in more than one mode, for example, internal and

workplace-based delivery.

Relational attributes

RULES

Delivery mode identifier  must be ‘NNN’ when Outcome identifier — national  is either ‘51’, ‘52’,

or ‘60’.

GUIDELINES FOR USE

Delivery mode identifier  is a 3-character field composed of ‘Y’s and ‘N’s that identifies the

mode(s) of delivery of a unit of competency or module where each of the three positions indicates

a type of delivery. The field comprises the following structure:

First position indicates internal.

Second position indicates external.

Third position indicates workplace-based delivery.

Technology underpins much training delivery in today’s world so providing additional materials

online or incorporating technology into training that is otherwise face-to-face does not constitute

external delivery.

Internal delivery; e.g. classroom-based  (i.e. first position in field) is where the client  and the

trainer interact in real-time and physically attend training delivery locations organised or managed

by the training organisation. This includes workshop, laboratory, simulator and classroom-based

training even when the training is delivered using video or internet links in real time. The client

and trainer must interact in real-time and must attend a training delivery location to be classified

as internal.

External delivery; e.g. online  (i.e. second position in field) is where the client does not attend a

physical delivery location but instead  undertakes training at a location of their choosing and using

training materials that are provided online or by correspondence. A client learning at home either

by engaging with self-paced materials or interacting with a trainer in real-time would be classified

as external.

Similarly, the Room pulls from all rooms set up under the location that you selected prior.

Conference link is used if this event is also online i.e. a Zoom link. This can then be accessed via the portals.

Staff is who you expect to run the event. This can be anyone set up as staff at the Program level of the course.

Unit can be set up if this is a class for a specific unit under the course. If a unit is linked, this then allows trainers to mark enrolment

units as competent when they are marking attendance.

Series is used to link the event with an existing group of events. As example of the use-case is that this then makes it easier to

understand if multiple events are for the same unit.

ISSUE: When creating a new event, there is an option to create “New from Series”…

29

… but even when selecting the option to create a new series, the Series field is not updated in the UI until after you have created the

event. This will need to be flagged as an issue for the product team to look into.

English Level is another optional field that is likely only used by a select one or two clients.

External ID is an identifying field that is available in our API. Clients may want to use this ID for various external updates.

Allow bulk update means that if you are updating another event under the same series, this event will also be updated accordingly.

Disable this option if you don’t want this to occur.

Publish to Portals means that the event will be displayed in self-service portals.

Minimum and Maximum Number of Attendees control how many people must or can attend the event. If you attempt to add more

people to the event than the maximum allows for, you will have an error returned when attempting to save the event.

Description gives an overview of what the event covers. This field allows for far more characters to be used if further specifics need to

be provided.

_____________________________________________________________________________________ Key Changes: New integration with aNewSpring Learning Management System  Reproduce invoice documents in Finance Hub  Invoice Lists – New columns for Paid and Deferred Planned Release Dates Phase I: Tuesday 17 May 2022 Phase II: Tuesday 24 May 2022 _____________________________________________________________________________________ New aNewSpring LMS integration aNewSpring is an adaptive learning management system that empowers training companies to craft, curate and deliver blended learning. It is customised for the Australian VET Sector and now integrated with JobReady Plus. aNewSpring allows training providers to build high-impact content quickly and easily. Ideal for blended and social learning settings, this intuitive platform has extensive learner discussion board facilities integrated throughout, as well as complex, behind-the-scenes algorithms that automatically adapt the content of each course to each learner. Click here to find out more about the aNewSpring integration Improved 2 Logic improvements for First Attendance We’ve updated the logic when Set Unit Outcome and Start Date on First Attendance flag is enabled. It will now ALWAYS update the Unit Outcome and Start Date whenever the unit has an outcome with the “Enrolled Outcome” option selected. Previously, it would only perform this on First Attendance if the units “start date” value was newer than the attendance date.

Introducing the Ready LMS Integration (Powered by aNewSpring)

The Ready LMS learning enhancement platform empowers training providers to create, curate and deliver blended learning that adapts to each individual learner. Introducing the Ready LMS integration! This integration includes:

Resulting rules configured against outcome types - allowing for flexible resulting across VET, Higher Education, and non-reportable courses.

Map your courses, course units, or course units of study to courses in Ready LMS or create new Ready LMS courses directly from your student management system.

Set preservability properties for new Ready LMS courses created from your system.

Map course units and units of study to

Ready LMS

activities. You can map multiple units/units of study in your SMS course to multiple course activities in Ready LMS, allowing those units to be resulted in your SMS as the corresponding activities are completed in Ready LMS.

Transfer course/enrolment staff to

Ready LMS. Send one or multiple staff to Ready LMS as Instructors, giving them access to students enrolled in mapped Ready LMS courses.

Transfer enrolments to

Ready LMS. Send one or multiple enrolments in a Course, along with party details, to Ready LMS for online learning.

Remove student enrolments from

Ready LMS. From the course integration settings, select enrolments on the Enrolled tab to remove them from Ready LMS.

Automated result transfer from

Ready LMS. Every hour, your system will retrieve the latest assessment data for mapped Ready LMS courses and results units and units of study. Manually start the resulting transfer from integration preferences.

Integrations Centre. The Integration Centre lists all SMS enrolments enrolled or that could enrol into Ready LMS courses. The status indicates whether the enrolment is pending, failed, or successfully sent. From here, you can attempt to send a pending enrolment or re-attempt any that failed.

AVETMISS – Course State Filter  We have relaxed the filter on Course State when using the AVETMISS wizard and Claims Reporting wizard. An enrolment with a contract will use the state for the contract, instead of the associated State of the course. Previously, the extract logic would filter on both Course State and the Contract State, so if there was a mismatch it wouldn’t appear in the file outputs. Predominant Delivery Mode  When selecting a Delivery Mode

for a course, enrolment or unit, the options available in the Predominant Delivery

Mode select list are now filtered to only list options that are relevant for the selected Delivery Mode. Party Audit Trail

We’ve updated the Party Audit Trail to record data changes to the Party AVETMISS page. Fields included:

Country of Birth  Town/City of Birth  Nationality  Prior Educational Achievement Identifier  Prior Educational Achievement Recognition Identifier  Citizenship Status  Citizenship Effective From Date  Citizenship History > Citizenship Status  Citizenship History > Effective From Date  Disability Type  Disability Type > Start and End Dates     Permissions updates   Integration Program instance settings  We’ve added a new User Role permission that allows access to the Integrations menu from a Program record. Users without this permission will not be able to view this menu option. System Status  We’ve added a new User Role permission that allows access to the System Status menu, within the Administration tab. Users without this permission will not be able to view this menu option. Victoria VSN Export  We’ve added a new User Role permission that allows access to the Victorian VSN Export menu, within the Administration tab. Users without this permission will not be able to view this menu option.

ticket_content.ticket_description: *** needs to know the process of how to add Google Ads Tracker Codes to the Course Forms snippets and whether they need to get a different code for the different courses/forms

response.answer:
Adding Google Ads Tracker codes to your Course Forms is possible through custom HTML/JavaScript snippets. Each Course Form would require a unique Google Ads Tracker code specific to that course/form to properly track conversions. [3]

The process to implement this is not covered in our current documentation. I will need to consult with our development team to provide the full steps and ensure proper implementation for your requirements. [10]

Could you please provide some additional details:
1. Which specific courses/forms do you need to add tracker codes for?
2. Do you already have the Google Ads Tracker codes, or do you need assistance obtaining them?

With those details, I can work with our team to outline the full process and custom code required. Please let me know if you have any other questions!

related_knowledge.content: Please contact ReadyTech Support if you'd like QR codes to be added to your certificate templates. QR Codes on Party Profile Pages  Another exciting feature enabled by QR codes is their integration into party profile pages. To access the QR code for a party profile, simply click on the settings button located on the profile page, then click on "QR Code". A QR code will be displayed, scanning it will take you directly to the current party profile. Share this QR code with others to help them access the profile with ease. QR Codes for Course Applications  QR codes can also be used for course applications, streamlining the process of accessing a course form and submitting an application. First, navigate to any course with a course form linked and go to Admin → Application Forms. On any of the application forms, click on the QR code icon. A QR code will be generated, allowing the student to access the course form quickly and conveniently. Note  The functionality of QR codes for course applications is not restricted behind the QR Codes feature flag, meaning you can use this feature without any additional setup.

Generating Certificates We have improved the certificate recording process in the Progress Centre to allow users to specify additional certificate fields. Currently you can only enter these by editing the individual certificates after they have been created.

New Certificate Merge fields for Letter Templates

We have added Issued and Recorded Dates fields and TCSI Early Exit Award data fields on recorded Certificates as merge fields that can be used in a Certificate Template.

Updating Delivery Mode / Predominant Delivery Mode when recording CT / RPL results We have updated the behaviour when recording a Credit Transfer or Recognition of Prior Learning outcome so that the Delivery Mode and Predominant Delivery Mode are updated to the correct values when recording activity from the Enrolment->Edit Units page. This will also be the case when recording these results from other areas within the system, eg Mass Action Centre, Progress Centre and when Bulk Updating units from the Course page. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

A DMARC policy is an authentication protocol that can be added to your domain to help protect against fraud and increase deliverability. Beginning in

2024, Mandrill requires a minimum DMARC policy of "v=DMARC1; p=none" to be added to any sending domain. Read more about additional

configurations available at Home .

Some domain hosts automatically add 'Free classifieds - yourdomain.com ' after the initial value — contact your domain provider for any specifics

JR Plus gets requests from ASQA to provide RTO data if an RTO is closed down or is in liquidation.

Process

Prior to moving forward, we require written consent from either the owner or liquidator verifying our authorization to supply data directly to

Setting the payment type to ‘deposit' and excluding the invoice number in the payload will create the deposit payment and generate the respective invoice based on the configured system preferences. Prospects  We have introduced several parameters to the List Prospects endpoint, which will enable users to return a more tailored set of records. See API documentation for full details. Parties  We now support the use of Address ID for updating a specific address in the update Parties endpoint. TCSI Reporting - Field of Education Fields  The Field of Education fields on a Program now allow selection of either a 'narrow' (4 digit) or 'detailed' (6 digit) code, as required by TCSI. If a program with a 'detailed' Field of Education code is reported in AVETMISS, it is automatically reported as the corresponding 'narrow' code. NSW Claims Smart and Skilled Reporting – Transition Enrolments and Credit Transfer scenarios  This change introduces improved logic for NSW Claims Smart and Skilled reporting and enrolments to transitioned qualifications. In transitioned enrolment scenarios, when a unit in the current enrolment has an outcome of Credit Transfer because it was completed in the original enrolment, the unit with the Credit Transfer outcome will not be included in the NAT120 file. The original unit will only appear in the NAT120 with an outcome of 20 (Completed) or 51 (RPL granted).

heading: In this area, you will need to enter:

Agent Commission: If ticked, any Agent Commission calculations will be taken into account when using this Smart Fee item. Discount (Code): This checkbox will allow discounts to be applied to this Smart Fee item. Enabled: This checkbox can be utilised to archive this Smart Fee item if it is no longer to be used. Scholarships: Ticking this option will indicate it is eligible to utilise Scholarship details. The final data entry section is the Amount heading:  In this area, you will need to enter:  Ledger: Nominate a relevant Income Ledger code for the item, often corresponding to an account that is in use. (required)  Amount: Enter an amount that best represents this fee item.

(required)  Total: Lists the total amount calculated as part of this Smart Fee item. Allow Amount Adjustment: When disabled, the Amount cannot be manually updated elsewhere within the system. Subledger: Can optionally be used for additional account sorting alongside the top level Ledger element. Tax: Indicate if the item is GST exempt or has GST applied. Multiplier: The fee will be dynamically calculated using the base rate multiplied by the hours of each individual enrolled unit. Modifier Rules: Modifiers allow the amount invoiced for this smart fee to be automatically adjusted according to the chosen pre-configured rates for fee concessions or fee waivers. Other headings within this page are dedicated to specific configuration options, detailed below. Links  Links will be used to determine whether the Smart Fee is displayed during the creation of a New Enrolment. A Smart Fee must have at least one Link Type to be a candidate during the creation of a New Enrolment. To add a Link Type, press the [+ Link Type] button. From the expanded menu, select the Link Option

New Trainer Role – Access all parties  We have added a new System Role for trainers '- access_to_all_parties' that can be enabled in the Administration > Security area. This will enable anyone with that role to access any party record (excluding Agents and Host Families). Address related changes  Address Format  We have updated Party and Host screens to better support different address types. Users are now able to choose which type of address format to save, ‘Basic’ or ‘Detailed’. The ‘Basic’ address format is the standard used in postage, whereby the unit number, street number and street name are stored and presented as a single field. This is ideal for those providers that want to integrate with third-party CRMs via API. The ‘Detailed’ address format records each of the elements that form an address as individual fields. This is the required address format for AVETMISS reporting. Address Format Preferences  System administrators can configure which address formats are used for new addresses in the system under Administration > Configuration > Preferences > Preferences/Settings. The following options are available:

'Both – Detailed default'. Both address formats will be available for selection with the Detailed format being selected by default. 'Both – Basic default'. Both address formats will be available for selection with the Basic format being selected by default. 'Detailed only'. The Basic format will not be available for selection. 'Basic only'. The Detailed format will not be available for selection. Templates Rules – Certificates generated through Automate on a Program  We have improved the Automate process for generating Certificates on completion of a course. In addition to requiring all units to be complete with an end date, this process will now refer to template rules of the template assigned to the program before generating the certificate. This means that other rules like no USI can also be checked before a certificate will be generated.

5 Delivery Mode Predominant Predominant delivery mode identifies which of the modes available in combination in the Delivery mode identifier field is the largest or only component of delivery for subject activity. All States, except WA Required in NAT120 Course > Details > State Specific Data > Delivery Mode Predominant

Additional Files

NAT00010A Training Organisation File - National VET Collection supplement for non-Training.gov.au information — for reporting non-registered training organisation data. NAT00030A Program File - in National VET Collection supplement for non-Training.gov.au information — for reporting locally recognised programs.

Please note - The system will automatically choose required files for both National and State-specific reporting. A manual override option is available in case you need to produce a specific file (e.g NAT 10 or 10A).

System Settings  The first section targets your specific System Details:    The fields in this section require:   System: Will be set as the default 'TCSI'  Name: A custom name can be provided for this integration - Otherwise 'TCSI PRODA' is sufficient  VET Provider / HEP Provider check boxes: Check to flag the kind of provider your organisation is  Provider Code: The provider code of the education provider as supplied by DESE when the organisation was registered as a provider  Provider Name: The name of the education provider as registered with DESE  Enabled: Indicates if this integration is active. When unchecked this will disable the PRODA communication  Real-time Sync: When enabled, records will be synced to TCSI as soon as they are updated  Show on Integrations Centre: Toggles the display of this item within the Integrations Centre PRODA Settings  In this area, enter the Device Settings that were configured within PRODA for your B2B device. Note: All of the details to be entered in this area must first be configured by creating a B2B Device Option within PRODA.

For steps on completing this process, please view the help resource available here:  Managing B2B Devices    This section has the following options:   Device Activation Code: Generated within PRODA to validate system access  Device Name: Configured within PRODA to recognise your system  Organisation RA: Registration Authority (RA) number (unique to your organisation)      Notification Settings  It is recommended to update this with an email address to be reminded when the PRODA device expiry is approaching    In this area, enter a preferred Notification Email and specify if you require a notification for the device expiry date. With the above information entered and saved, press the Test Connection button to ensure everything is working correctly.

(I’m fairly sure they pull data on the employment records as you would expect, but normally you would select an enrolment to get to this

This option does nothing. It was added ages ago and never had any functionality included for it.

The inactive button is for seeing options flagged as inactive (think already completed enrolments).

193

The Entry Points

As a general rule the entry point in the code is the name of what you have selected, all lowercase with underscores between words. The

following is a list of the commonly used entry points:

party for parties

student for enrolments

event for events

course_applicationfor course applications

coursefor courses

It’s important to note that most options you select will have multiple entry points. For example, if you select an enrolment you will have

access to the following entry points:

student for the enrolment

coursefor the enrolment’s course

course_scope for the enrolment’s program (this is what programs are called on the back end)

party for the enrolment’s party

If you are unsure of the entry points you have available, you can find a list by using the code snippet {local_variables}.

The Basic Workflow

After selecting your entry point you can now start writing code. The simplest code I can think of is {party.inspect}. The components of

this code are as follows:

{} go around all of your code in the system.

party tells the system you are wanting information on the party.

.inspect is used to tell the system you want to view the details of the party you selected as your entry point.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Can you let me know how I can change a user information in the Job Ready system,.  I need to remove one of the administrator and update with someone else. Is that something I can do or do you have to complete that for me.  Thanks  ******

response.answer:
To change user information and replace an existing administrator in Job Ready, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to Administration > Security > Users and click [+ New] [2]
2. Search for the new user's party record, or create a new one [2]
3. Enter the new user's information including a unique User ID (email), set the "Enabled" option, assign them the required administrative roles, and set a temporary password [2]
4. Set the appropriate start date for their access, and optionally an end date if needed [2]

After adding the new administrator user, you should also be able to update or remove the previous user by locating their record in the Users list and either editing their information or deactivating/deleting their account [2, implied].

If you have any trouble with this process or need further assistance, I can reach out to our internal teams to investigate further options. [5]

related_knowledge.content: Learners  The Learners section allows you to review and distribute Student records to Ready LMS. This process will allow creation of a Ready LMS user account, as well as enrol the party record into the configured Ready LMS course. Note: An Email is required for any party records processed from this area. Party data that will be sent to Ready LMS includes:   Email (Set as Username)  Title  Phone Number  First Name  Middle Name  Surname  Email  Date of Birth      Ready LMS User Creation  When a Student/Staff member is enrolled into a Ready LMS item, a user account will be created for them. They will then receive an email detailing their login information, similar to the following:      Hi John,  An account has been created for you at 'Ready LMS Site' and you have been issued with a new temporary password. Your current login information is:  Username: person@fake-email.com  Password: password  (You will be required to change your password upon login)  To start using 'Ready LMS Site', login with your credentials. In most mail programs, this should appear as a blue link which you can click on – if that doesn't work, copy and paste the address into the top of your web browser window. Cheers from the 'Ready LMS Site' administrator. Not Enrolled Tab  This tab serves to display all staff and students who are yet to be enrolled in at least one of the linked Ready LMS courses.

Process: Add a User

A user can log in to the Student Management System and is responsible for administering and managing the system's data. For example, Administrators, Academics (Trainers/Assessors), Marketing Managers, Compliance Managers, and Finance Managers. Warning  We do not recommend sharing user access between multiple individuals. This ensures that all changes and updates within the system can be appropriately logged and tracked.

Add a User  To add a New User, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Security → Users. Click the [+ New] button. To add a User, a Party record must first exist.Choose whether to:  Search for an Existing Party Record,  Create a New Party Record. Complete the New User Window      User ID - This value must be unique and will be the user's username. Organisations typically use an individuals email address. Enabled - By default, the system will check this box. If checked, the user can access the system. Academic - If checked, the Available Roles list below will change from Administrative Roles to Academic Roles limiting their access to the system and its data. Password - Set a unique, temporary password for the new user. On the first login, the system will prompt the user to change their password. Clicking on the Reset button will send a password reset email to the user. Start Date - This determines from which date the user can access the platform. It acts as a record-keeping for when a User is provided with access. End Date - This determines from which date the user can no longer access the platform. It acts as a record-keeping for when a Users access is revoked. Leave this field blank if it is indefinite. Access Level - An Access Levels impacts whether a User can make adjustments to another User. For example, if the user is a Level 1, they can adjust the roles and permissions for Level 1, 2, and 3.

Process: Adding a Staff Profile

The Staff section is where you create and view available Staff records, including: Academics, Assessors, and Coordinators. In this article, we will go over the process of creating a Staff profile. We recommend setting up your Staff record prior to creating Course Enrolments. This is so that they populate in the drop-down list of available staff when you are enrolling a student into a course and linking them to their respective Course/Unit offers. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Setting Up Your Reference Data  Add a Staff profile to a Party Profile

Warning  Staff Profiles can be set against Party profiles or User profiles.

During the set up, the system will prompt you to create a new Staff record from an existing Profile of the system or create a new Party record. Adding a Staff profile against an existing party record will not automatically allow them to log in as User and perform actions against students and courses. This is more for internal record keeping purposes and the system will only recognise them internally by their set Staff type. Adding a Staff profile against an existing User will allow the User of the system to log in as it's set Staff type and perform actions against students and courses. If you would like for the new Staff record to have user access, follow the steps in the article on how to Add a User Profile. Setting Up Your Reference Data  Before creating a Staff record, ensure the following reference data is set up so that they can be available to select during the Staff creation process. Reference Data can be accessed via Administration → Lookups → Reference Data. Job Title - Staff can have titles set against them for internal record keeping purposes.

Staff Types - An internal identifier that can be set against Staff record for internal record keeping purposes.

Employment Basis - Select the Staff employment for record keeping purposes.

This unit data sometimes needs to be preserved for certain reporting bodies, so please use this feature with caution. Exceptions To Be Aware Of  There are a few exceptions to this feature that you need to be aware of. The unit status will not be transferred if:   The other enrolment has a status that is not set as an active status. Enrolment statuses can be configured from Administration → Lookups →

Reference Data →

Enrolment Status. If the unit in the other enrolment already has a competent outcome.

If the other enrolment has an end date in the past.

If any of these are true, the unit information will not be transferred. Manually Excluding Units From This Feature  If there are any units that you would rather not use this feature for, an option exists to exclude them.

Simply go to Administration → Curriculum → Units and find the unit you want to exclude.

Click on the Edit button and choose the Disable Auto Credit Transfer Recognition checkbox.

This will effectively remove the unit from being used with this feature.

Note  If you are interested in using this feature, please contact the ReadyTech Support Team and request for this feature to be enabled.

Setting Up A Course To Work Within Ready LMS

Once Ready LMS has been successfully set up, you can link the integration to a course that is being delivered. Required: Add A New Course  This process requires that a Course has been created within your system. Process: Add a New Course    TABLE OF CONTENTS    Flagging a Course   Settings  Ready LMS Course Mappings  Linking to Ready LMS  Linked Status Resulting  Learners  Ready LMS User Creation  Not Enrolled Tab  Enrolled Tab      Flagging a Course  You can flag a Course within your system to use the Ready LMS integration. Start by selecting an existing Course you wish to manage within your system:     On the left, select the Admin heading, and then Integrations:     Click the Settings button under Ready LMS:    This will open the Ready LMS Integration Settingspage for this course. Settings  This first area controls the ability to automatically push information into Ready LMS. These items include:   Enabled: Controls if the integration is active for this course. Toggling this item to 'off' will stop the regular updates of information from Ready LMS to this course  Allow Export: Allows data to be sent to Ready LMS, including Course, Staff and Student details  Auto push learners: IF set to off, Ready LMS will not automatically export any student as a user – or enrol any student into a course. For information to update within Ready LMS, it is recommended that these items are set to ON for the integration to function.

Configuring Ready LMS within your System

Once your Ready LMS details have been established, the integration will need to be globally enabled and configured within your system to function. Required: Ready LMS System Settings  There are a range of settings within the Ready LMS environment that require configuration in order to integrate with your Student Management System – please ensure these are configured before attempting the steps detailed here. Ready LMS System Settings    TABLE OF CONTENTS    Enabling the Ready LMS Plugin   Entering Ready LMS Integration Information  System Settings  Notification Settings  Preservability Settings  Resulting  Test Connection Next Steps: Course Setup            Enabling the Ready LMS Plugin   Under the Administration heading, select Preferences:   On the left-hand side, expand the Integration item and select Integrated Systems. This will open the Integrations Page, displaying any existing Integrated services/systems:  Click the [+] New button to start the process to implement a new integration:   The page that appears will display a range of Integrations available to set up, with search items and filters – such as the ability to view only LMS options. Locate the Ready LMS item that appears like so:   Press the Connect button will open a new page to enter your Ready LMS Integration Information.
